content.description: An awesome warm-up, follow the long right-arching crack system from left to right on the south face. The big flake sounds a bit hollow, don't crank too hard.
content.location: On the south face of the Zoolander boulder.

content.description: Start on nothing slab, and work your way up into a small overhang. Climb around using what holds you can find, going straight up.
content.location: This is on the south face of the Zoolander boulder, just right of the crack systems.

content.description: An easy, low-angled crack system that has some pretty fun movement.
content.location: On the south face, the west-most crack system.

content.description: Stand start on a decent crimp rail and head up. The topout is committing, but the holds are good enough. Really fun movement, one of the best on the boulder.There is a sit start that goes around V7, according to the Guide.
content.location: On the southwestern side of the Zoolander Boulder, this problem is found on the ripple-featured face.

content.description: This problem isn't too hard if you've got long arms and/or campus power, but without those is practically V6. Stand start on a good crimp flake, and head left and up into the power move, or try to finesse it.
content.location: The Campus boulder is facing the Zoolander boulder, just across the talus and over the creek. When at the Zoolander boulder, look west and you'll see the obvious overhung face. 3-Star Throw starts on the right side of the boulder with the obvious rail.

pathTokens: Archangel Valley Bouldering - Diamond, Fairangel, Monolith, Roadside, Indianhead

content.description: Most of this information can be better elaborated on in the Alaska Bouldering Guide (climbak.com/book-inner).    Large, interesting boulders found up in the talus just west of Monolith. There is a creek flowing underneath the talus that makes the ambiance very relaxing. Landings are fairly well built-out, but still leave something to be desired in some cases. Bring bug spray.    Many of the problems here have both stand and harder sit starts.
